41-year-old, currently Controller of BBC Global News, replaces Andy Coulson , who resigned earlier this month amid the continuing row over phone-hacking when he was editor of the News of the World. Mr David Cameron said: I am very pleased that Craig Oliver is to become the new Director of Communications at 10 Downing Street. " Craig Oliver has formidable experience as a broadcast journalist. He will do an excellent job in explaining and communicating the Government's programme. executive chairman, "a lot of my time" will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said. "We've got very complicated government issues," he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries.
